etymologies: early 16th century: from French spinelle, from Italian spinella, diminutive of spina ‘thorn’

definitions: a hard glassy mineral occurring as octahedral crystals of variable color and consisting chiefly of magnesium and aluminum oxides.
shortDefinitions: hard glassy mineral occurring as octahedral crystals of variable colour and consisting chiefly of magnesium and aluminium oxides

definitions: any of a class of oxides including this, containing aluminum and another metal and having the general formula MAl₂O₄.
shortDefinitions: any of class of oxides including spinel, containing aluminium and another metal and having general formula MAl ₂ O ₄
